head.title: DNA Results Announced In Smith Case

hedline.hl1: DNA Results Announced In Smith Case
hedline.hl2: DNA Results Announced in Smith Case

abstract.p: DNA test results indicate that Larry Birkhead is father of Anna Nicole Smith's child (M)

block.p: Larry Birkhead, the former boyfriend of the late Anna Nicole Smith who had been insisting that he was the father of her child, emerged from a courtroom in the Bahamas on Tuesday with his hands held high over his head and declared, ''I told you so.''

Dr. Michael Baird, who analyzed the results of a March 21 DNA test, said a Bahamian judge had accepted his conclusions about who was the father of Dannielynn, the child born to Ms. Smith in September.
A doctor who analyzed the results of a DNA test said Larry Birkhead, the former boyfriend of Anna Nicole Smith, was the father of her child.

Larry Birkhead, the former boyfriend of the late Anna Nicole Smith who had been insisting that he was the father of her child, emerged from a courtroom in the Bahamas on Tuesday with his hands held high over his head and declared, ''I told you so.''

Dr. Michael Baird, who analyzed the results of a March 21 DNA test, said a Bahamian judge had accepted his conclusions about who was the father of Dannielynn, the child born to Ms. Smith in September.
''Essentially, he's the biological father,'' Dr. Baird said of Mr. Birkhead.
Ms. Smith, a former stripper and Playboy Playmate of the Year, died Feb. 8, apparently from an accidental overdose of prescription drugs.

Ms. Smith's companion and former lawyer, Howard K. Stern, had been listed on the birth certificate as the father of the baby and had been fighting for custody of the child, who was born in the Bahamas. After the judge's decision, he dropped the custody fight.

Mr. Birkhead, a freelance photographer from California, was clearly elated about the ruling. ''My baby's going to be coming home pretty soon,'' he said before television cameras outside the courtroom.
The baby has been in the custody of Mr. Stern, living in the house in the Bahamas that he shared with Ms. Smith.

Mr. Stern, who was also at the hearing, emerged from the courthouse and said he would not fight the decision declaring Mr. Birkhead the father. ''My feelings for Dannielynn have not changed,'' Mr. Stern said. ''I am not going to fight Larry Birkhead for custody. I'm going to do whatever I can do to make sure he gets sole custody.''

The infant girl stands to inherit millions of dollars from the estate of Ms. Smith, who was involved in litigation over whether she would share in the inheritance from her husband, J. Howard Marshall II, a Texas oil billionaire who died in 1995.
